8.2.1	one Party is in breach of its obligations hereunder and fails to cure such breach within two (2) Business Days following the other

perturbation.explanation: Reducing the cure period to two business days may be considered unreasonably short under PRC law, particularly for complex breaches. This could be viewed as a violation of good faith principles and potentially render the termination clause unenforceable.

perturbation.original_text:
11.2	Any dispute, conflict or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or the performance hereof shall be resolved by the Parties 
through amicable negotiation, which negotiation shall commence immediately upon notice by one Party to the other of the nature of 
such dispute, conflict or claim. In the event that such dispute is not resolved within thirty (30) Business Days following such notice, 
either Party may upon the expiration of the such 30-day notice period submit such dispute to arbitration by the Hong Kong International 
Arbitration Centre in accordance with the arbitration rules of such centre then in effect. The arbitration shall be conducted in Hong 
Kong in English and the arbitral award shall be binding upon both Parties. During the resolution (including the arbitration) of the 
dispute, the Parties shall continue to perform other portions of this Agreement unaffected by such dispute.
perturbation.changed_text:
11.2	Any dispute, conflict or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or the performance hereof shall be resolved by the Parties 
through amicable negotiation, which negotiation shall commence immediately upon notice by one Party to the other of the nature of 
such dispute, conflict or claim. In the event that such dispute is not resolved within five (5) Business Days following such notice, 
either Party may upon the expiration of the such 5-day notice period submit such dispute to arbitration by the Hong Kong International 
Arbitration Centre in accordance with the arbitration rules of such centre then in effect. The arbitration shall be conducted in Hong 
Kong in English and the arbitral award shall be binding upon both Parties. During the resolution (including the arbitration) of the 
dispute, the Parties shall continue to perform other portions of this Agreement unaffected by such dispute.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the negotiation period before arbitration to five business days may be considered insufficient under PRC law for complex commercial disputes. Courts in China might view such a short negotiation period as a failure to genuinely attempt amicable resolution, potentially impacting the enforceability of the arbitration agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Arbitration Law of the People's Republic of China, Contract Law of the People's Republic of China

Written Document shall be deemed duly given by one 
Party to the other upon personal delivery to the address of the other Party; or on a date which is four (4) business days from the date on 
which the Written Document is posted through registered or certified mail (postage prepaid and return receipt 
requested), regardless of whether the Written Document is actually received; or on the first business day following the date on which 
the Written Document is sent by express service (as indicated by the written receipt confirmation); or as indicated on the confirmation 
report of the fax machine confirming that the Written Document is delivered by fax successfully.
perturbation.changed_text:
Written Document shall be deemed duly given by one 
Party to the other upon personal delivery to the address of the other Party; or on a date which is fifteen (15) business days from the date on 
which the Written Document is posted through registered or certified mail (postage prepaid and return receipt 
requested), regardless of whether the Written Document is actually received; or on the tenth business day following the date on which 
the Written Document is sent by express service (as indicated by the written receipt confirmation); or as indicated on the confirmation 
report of the fax machine confirming that the Written Document is delivered by fax successfully.
perturbation.explanation: Lengthening the delivery times for written documents to fifteen business days for registered mail, and ten for express could be viewed as not commercially reasonable, and cause a delay in the other party receiving the needed documentation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law of the People's Republic of China
